name: Vanela Gathiya.
desc: This is another extremely popular type of gathiya, and a true specialty of the Saurashtra region. Unlike the crispy Fafda, Vanela Gathiya are hand-rolled (vanela), making them softer, thicker, and more porous, so they almost melt in your mouth.

name: Fafda Gathiya
desc: A famous and crispy Gujarati snack, Fafda is a type of gathiya made from gram flour, rolled into long, flat strips, and deep-fried. They are savory, crunchy, and absolutely delicious.

name: Jalebi
desc: A beloved sweet across India, Jalebi is made by deep-frying a fermented flour batter in intricate spiral shapes and then soaking it in warm sugar syrup.

name: Chieps
desc: While not a traditional Gujarati farsan, French Fries are a universally loved snack. These are deep-fried potato sticks, perfectly golden and crispy on the outside while remaining soft and fluffy on the inside.

name: Sev Khamani
desc: Also known as Amiri Khaman, this is a delicious and popular Gujarati street food dish. It's made by crumbling fresh Khaman dhokla and then tempering it with spices, garlic, and a touch of sugar.

name: Khaman Dhokl
desc: This is the quintessential Gujarati snack, Khaman Dhokla. Made from a steamed, fermented batter of gram flour (chana dal), these cakes are incredibly soft, spongy, and light.

name: Full dish(Gujrati)
desc: This image showcases a spectacular Gujarati Thali, a hallmark of the cuisine here in our region of Kathiyawad. A thali is a complete, well-balanced meal served on a single platter, designed to offer a symphony of flavors—sweet, sour, spicy, and savory—all in perfect harmony.

name: Full dish(Rajasthani )
desc: This platter is a stunning example of a royal Rajasthani Thali, representing the robust and vibrant cuisine of the neighboring state of Rajasthan. Known for its rich, spicy flavors and generous use of ghee, a Rajasthani meal is truly a feast.

name: Margherita Pizza
desc: This is the iconic Margherita Pizza, a true Italian classic.

name: Cheese Pizza
desc: This is the classic, universally loved Cheese Pizza, pictured fresh from a wood-fired oven.

name: Veg. Pizza
desc: This image shows a loaded and colorful Vegetable Pizza.

name: Italian Pizza
desc: This appears to be a classic Italian-style pepperoni pizza.

name: American Pizza
desc: This picture displays a classic American-style pizza, known for its hearty crust and generous toppings.

name: Crunchy Masala MAGGI
desc: Enjoy a variety of artisan cheeses, paired with an assortment of crispy crackers and complemented by fresh fruits and nuts. A delightful snack option for sharing or indulging in on your own.

name: Vegetable Masala Maggi
desc: Savor the satisfying crunch of crispy chicken wings seasoned to perfection. Choose your favorite sauce, from tangy BBQ to spicy buffalo, for a flavorful snacking experience.

name: Cheese Maggi
desc: Enjoy succulent pieces of marinated paneer (Indian cottage cheese) skewered and grilled to perfection. Served with mint chutney, these paneer tikka skewers offer a flavorful and aromatic Indian snack experience.

name: Tadka Maggi
desc: Relish the smooth and flavorful hummus accompanied by a variety of fresh vegetable sticks and pita bread. A nutritious and satisfying option for a light and refreshing snack.

name: Cheese Chilli Grilled
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Cheese Garlic Grilled Sandwich
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Cheese Masala Toast Sandwich
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Club Sandwich
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Masala Toast Sandwich
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Paneer Tandoori  Grilled Sandwich
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Veg Cheese Grilled Sandwich
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Veg Grilled Sandwich
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Veg-sandwich
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for PaneerButterMasala.

name: Kaju Butter Masala
desc: Similar to Kaju Curry, this dish specifically features whole cashew nuts in a smooth, buttery, and creamy tomato gravy, much like the one used for Paneer Butter Masala.

name: Kaju Curry
desc: Also known as Kaju Masala, this is a festive and luxurious dish, especially popular here in Gujarat and Rajasthan.

name: Kaju Paneer Butter Masala
desc: This dish is a delightful fusion, combining two popular preparations. It includes both soft cubes of paneer and whole, creamy cashews cooked together in a single, rich butter masala gravy.

name: Kaju paneer kofta
desc: This is an exquisite kofta variation where the dumplings themselves are made from a rich mixture of crumbled paneer and ground cashews.

name: Matar Paneer
desc: This is a classic North Indian curry featuring soft cubes of paneer (Indian cheese) and sweet green peas (matar) simmered in a moderately spiced, creamy tomato-based gravy.

name: Palak-paneer
desc: A vibrant and healthy dish, Palak Paneer consists of paneer cubes cooked in a thick, smooth purée of spinach (palak). It's seasoned with garlic, ginger, and other aromatic spices.

name: Paneer Angara
desc: Angara means and this dish lives up to its name with a distinct, smoky flavor. This is achieved by infusing the curry with smoke from a hot piece of charcoal.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
desc: One of the most beloved Indian dishes, Paneer Butter Masala (or Paneer Makhani) features soft paneer cubes in a characteristically smooth, velvety, and creamy tomato-based gravy.

name: Paneer Capsicum
desc: A simple yet delicious curry where the primary ingredients are paneer and bell peppers (capsicum). It's cooked in a flavorful onion-tomato gravy that complements the sweetness of the capsicum.

name: Paneer Cheese Butter Masala
desc: This is an even more indulgent version of the classic Paneer Butter Masala. It takes the signature creamy, buttery tomato gravy with soft paneer cubes.

name: Paneer Handi
desc: Traditionally cooked in an earthenware pot called a handi, this dish has a unique, earthy aroma. The slow-cooking process results in a very flavorful and rich curry.

name: Paneer Kadai
desc: Served traditionally in a kadai (a wok-like pan), this dish is known for its robust and spicy flavors. It features chunks of paneer and bell peppers (capsicum).

name: Paneer Kofta
desc: This dish consists of deep-fried dumplings (koftas) made from a mixture of crumbled paneer, potatoes, and aromatic spices.

name: Paneer Makhani
desc: This dish, whose name translates to  is essentially another name for the famous Paneer Butter Masala. It features soft cubes of paneer simmered in a signature rich, creamy, and velvety gravy.

name: Paneer Pasanda
desc: A truly decadent dish, Paneer Pasanda consists of fried paneer 'sandwiches'. Thin slices of paneer are stuffed with a rich mixture of nuts, herbs, and spices, then fried until golden.

name: Paneer Patiala
desc: This is a rich Punjabi dish with a unique presentation. It features fried rolls made from papad that are stuffed with a savory filling of spiced, crumbled paneer (paneer bhurji).

name: Paneer Shahi Korma
desc: Shahi means royal and this Mughlai dish is characterized by its exceptionally rich, creamy, and mildly spiced gravy.

name: Paneer Tawa
desc: This is a semi-dry curry cooked on a large flat griddle called a tawa. It has a tangy and spicy flavor profile, made with a base of onions, tomatoes, and a special blend of spices.

name: Paneer Tika
desc: This is a rich and popular dish where grilled or tandoor-cooked paneer cubes (paneer tikka) are simmered in a luxurious, creamy, and spiced tomato gravy.

name: Paneer Tufani
desc: The name Tufani means hinting at a storm of flavors and textures. This is a rich restaurant-style dish with a spicy and tangy gravy.

name: Paneer-bhurji
desc: Paneer Bhurji is a popular and quick preparation of scrambled Indian cottage cheese. Crumbled paneer is sautéed with finely chopped onions, tomatoes, and spices

name: Punjabi Shahi Paneer
desc: This is a Punjabi take on the classic Shahi (royal) paneer. It is served in a traditional copper kadai, showcasing its rich, smooth, orange-colored gravy.

name: Mix Veg
desc: This is a Punjabi take on the classic Shahi (royal) paneer. It is served in a traditional copper kadai, showcasing its rich, smooth, orange-colored gravy.

name: Allu Mutter
desc: A quintessential North Indian comfort food, Aloo Matar is a simple yet delicious curry of potatoes (aloo) and green peas (matar).

name: Veg Makhanwala
desc: This is a creamy, rich, and flavorful curry where assorted vegetables like cauliflower, carrots, and bell peppers are cooked in a smooth, buttery (makhan) tomato-based gravy.

name: Veg Kolhapuri
desc: Hailing from Kolhapur, Maharashtra, this dish is famous for its bold and spicy flavor profile. It consists of mixed vegetables cooked in a fiery red gravy made with a special, aromatic spice blend called Kolhapuri Masala.

name: veg Jaipuri
desc: A rich and aromatic curry from Rajasthani cuisine, Veg Jaipuri features mixed vegetables in a tangy and creamy cashew and tomato-based gravy.

name: Veg Hariyali
desc: Hariyali means greenery and this dish lives up to its name. It consists of various vegetables cooked in a vibrant and healthy gravy made from a purée of spinach, cilantro, and mint. This gives the curry its distinct green color and a fresh, herby flavor.

name: Veg Angara
desc: Like its paneer variant, Veg Angara is a smoky and spicy mixed vegetable curry. Its name, meaning ember comes from the unique preparation method where the dish is infused with the smoke of a burning piece of charcoal.

name: Veg Toofani
desc: The name Toofani translates to stormy which aptly describes the explosion of flavors and textures in this dish. It's a rich and spicy mixed vegetable.

name: Veg Kofta
desc: This dish features deep-fried dumplings (koftas) made from mashed or minced vegetables like bottle gourd (lauki), potato, and carrots.

name: Veg kadai
desc: A restaurant favorite, Veg Kadai is a delicious and robust curry cooked in a traditional wok (kadai). It features a mix of vegetables, especially chunky pieces of bell peppers and onions, tossed in a thick, spicy, and fragrant tomato-based masala.

name: Veg Handi
desc: Named after the traditional deep pot (handi) it's cooked in, this is a rich and creamy mixed vegetable curry. It typically includes a variety of vegetables like cauliflower and peas, often enriched with cashew nuts.

name: Veg Patiala
desc: This is a unique and impressive Punjabi dish. Its star feature is a roasted or fried papad that is stuffed with a savory filling of spiced vegetables or crumbled paneer. This stuffed roll is then served in a rich and tangy tomato-based gravy.

name: Dal Makhani
desc: This is a classic and highly celebrated dish from Punjabi cuisine. Presented beautifully in a traditional copper balti, Dal Makhani is a rich, creamy, and slow-cooked lentil curry. It's made with whole black lentils (urad dal) and kidney beans (rajma).

name: Veg Makhanwala (Vegetable Makhani)
desc: This dish is a vegetarian delight, featuring a medley of fresh vegetables such as carrots, peas, green beans, and cauliflower. They are cooked in a smooth, creamy, and buttery (makhan) gravy made from tomatoes, onions, and cashew paste.

name: Veg. Kadai
desc: This dish is a vegetarian delight, featuring a medley of fresh vegetables such as carrots, peas, green beans, and cauliflower. They are cooked in a smooth, creamy, and buttery (makhan) gravy made from tomatoes, onions, and cashew paste.

name: Chinese Bhel
desc: A creative and incredibly popular street-food snack, Chinese Bhel is an Indo-Chinese fusion dish. It's made by tossing crispy, deep-fried noodles with crunchy raw vegetables and a mix of tangy, sweet, and spicy sauces.

name: Dry Manchurian
desc: A classic and highly popular Indo-Chinese appetizer, Dry Manchurian consists of deep-fried balls made from minced vegetables like cabbage, carrots, and cauliflower.

name: Gravy Manchurian
desc: This is the main course version of the popular starter. The same delicious, crispy vegetable balls are simmered in a savory, glossy, and flavorful brown gravy thickened with cornflour.

name: Hakka Noodles
desc: A timeless Indo-Chinese classic, Hakka Noodles consists of boiled noodles stir-fried on high heat with crunchy, shredded vegetables like carrots, cabbage, and bell peppers.

name: Hyderabadi Veg Biryani
desc: This is a famous regional style of biryani from Hyderabad, known for its robust and spicy flavor profile.

name: Manchurian  Rice
desc: A favorite one-bowl meal, Manchurian Rice is a creative combination of vegetable fried rice and manchurian balls. The savory rice is tossed with vegetables and sauces, with the soft and tangy manchurian balls.

name: Manchurian Noodles
desc: Similar to Manchurian Rice, this dish combines two favorites into one. Stir-fried noodles are tossed in a tangy and savory manchurian-style sauce along with delicious vegetable manchurian balls.

name: Paneer Biryani
desc: A deliciously rich and satisfying option for vegetarians, Paneer Biryani features succulent cubes of marinated and fried paneer as the star ingredient.

name: Schezwan Fried Rice
desc: For those who love spicy food, Schezwan Fried Rice is the perfect choice. It's a fiery and flavorful variation of fried rice that gets its signature bold taste.

name: Veg Biryani
desc: A fragrant and royal rice dish, Veg Biryani is made by layering long-grain basmati rice with a medley of marinated vegetables, aromatic spices, herbs like mint and cilantro, and often saffron for color and flavor.

name: Veg Schezwan Noodles
desc: The noodles get their signature fiery taste and reddish-orange hue from being stir-fried in a generous amount of Schezwan sauce—a potent and aromatic paste made from red chilies, garlic, and ginger.

name: Batata
desc: This is the quintessential Gujarati comfort food, Rasawala Batata nu Shaak (potato curry with gravy).

name: Bharela rigan
desc: A cornerstone of Gujarati cooking, this is stuffed eggplant curry. Small, tender eggplants (ringan) are filled with a delicious sweet, spicy, and nutty stuffing made from peanuts, sesame, and spices

name: BHARELI DUNGRI
desc: In this rustic and intensely flavorful dish, small whole onions are filled with a spicy and nutty masala.

name: Bhindi Masala
desc: A popular Indian classic, Bhindi Masala is a flavorful dish made with okra (known as bhindi or bhinda).

name: Dahi Tikhari
desc: A classic, fiery curry from Kathiyawad, Dahi Tikhari is known for its bold flavors. It is a quick and simple preparation made from yogurt (dahi) and a generous amount of garlic and red chili, giving it a spicy kick (tikhu).

name: Kaju Gathiya
desc: A classic, fiery curry from Kathiyawad, Dahi Tikhari is known for its bold flavors. It is a quick and simple preparation made from yogurt (dahi) and a generous amount of garlic and red chili, giving it a spicy kick (tikhu).

name: Mix Kathol
desc: This image shows a hearty and popular North Indian curry combining two kinds of legumes: kidney beans (rajma) and chickpeas (chana).

name: Patra sabji
desc: A uniquely Gujarati delicacy, Patra nu Shaak features slices of steamed colocasia leaf rolls. These rolls, made by smearing the leaves with a sweet, sour, and spiced gram flour paste, are served in a flavorful gravy.

name: Rajawadi Undhiyu
desc: This is a  (Rajwadi) or restaurant-style take on Gujarat's famous winter vegetable casserole, Undhiyu. Unlike the traditional dry version, this one is served in a rich, red, spicy gravy.

name: Rajwadi Dhokli
desc: This is a royal (Rajwadi) version of the classic Dhokli nu Shaak. Instead of soft, boiled dumplings, this dish often features fried, diamond-shaped pieces of gram flour dhokli

name: Sev Tamatar
desc: This is a quick, tangy, and spicy curry made from a base of ripe tomatoes and aromatic spices. The star of the dish is the sev—thick, savory, and crunchy noodles made from gram flour.

name: Bhaji Dosa
desc: This is another fantastic fusion dish that combines two of India's most loved street foods: the South Indian Dosa and Mumbai's Pav Bhaji.

name: Cheese Masala Dosa
desc: A modern and indulgent take on the classic Masala Dosa. After being filled with the traditional spiced potato masala, it gets a generous topping of grated cheese, which melts slightly from the heat.

name: Chinese Dosa
desc: A creative and hugely popular Indo-Chinese fusion dish, especially loved at street food stalls here in Rajkot. The dosa is filled with a savory mixture of stir-fried noodles, vegetables, and tangy Chinese sauces.

name: Garlic Masala Dosa
desc: This dish combines the best of both worlds: it's a classic Masala Dosa stuffed with spiced potatoes, but with the added flavor bomb of a zesty garlic chutney spread on the inner layer of the crepe.

name: Garlic sada dosa
desc: A simple yet flavorful variation, the Sada Dosa is a plain, unfilled crepe. This  version has a spicy and aromatic garlic chutney or powder spread on the inside before being rolled into a crisp cylinder.

name: Paper dosa
desc: A visual delight, the Paper Dosa is an extra-large and wafer-thin version of the Sada Dosa. Its name comes from its paper-like thinness and incredible crispiness.

name: Masala Dosa
desc: This is the quintessential South Indian classic. It features a thin, savory crepe (dosa) made from fermented rice and lentil batter, cooked until golden and slightly crisp. It's filled with a delicious, spiced potato mixture (masala) and is traditionally served folded or rolled.

name: Idli
desc: A staple South Indian breakfast, Idli are soft, fluffy, steamed savory cakes made from a fermented batter of rice and lentils. They are naturally light, healthy, and easy to digest.

name: Masala Uttapam
desc: An Uttapam is a thick, savory pancake made from the same batter as a dosa. In a Masala Uttapam, a flavorful mixture of finely chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and cilantro is spread over the pancake while it cooks.

name: Medu Vada
desc: This is a popular South Indian fritter with a distinctive donut shape. Made from a spiced urad dal (black gram) batter, Medu Vada is delightfully crispy and golden on the outside while remaining soft and fluffy on the inside.

name: Mix. Uttapam
desc: This is a more colorful and loaded version of the classic uttapam, often called a Mixed Vegetable Uttapam. It is topped with a generous assortment of finely chopped vegetables like carrots, bell peppers, tomatoes, and onions.

name: Mysore Masala Dosa
desc: This is the complete and most famous Mysore-style dosa. It features the signature spicy red Mysore chutney spread on the inside, and is also filled with the traditional spiced potato mixture (masala).

name: Mysore Sada Dosa
desc: This dosa gets its unique character from the city of Mysore. Its defining feature is a layer of fiery red chutney, made from red chilies, garlic, and lentils, which is slathered on the inside of the dosa as it cooks.

name: Onion Tomato Uttapam
desc: Combining two of the most popular toppings, the Onion Tomato Uttapam is a crowd-pleaser. It is topped with a mix of both sweet, soft onions and tangy tomatoes.

name: Onion Uttapam
desc: A very popular variation, the Onion Uttapam is topped with a generous amount of finely chopped onions, which are pressed into the batter as it cooks.

name: Sada Dosa
desc: The Sada Dosa is the classic, plain version of the famous South Indian crepe. Made from a fermented batter of rice and lentils, it is cooked until golden and wonderfully crisp, then rolled or folded.

name: Sada Uttapam
desc: The simplest form of the savory South Indian pancake, the Sada Uttapam is made with a thick, fermented rice and lentil batter. It is plain, without any major toppings, though it may have herbs like cilantro mixed into the batter.

name: Spring Dosa
desc: A popular and modern fusion dish, the Spring Dosa is an Indian take on the Chinese spring roll. The crispy dosa is filled with a savory and crunchy mixture of stir-fried vegetables like cabbage, carrots, and bell peppers.

name: Tomato Uttapam
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Bhakhri
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Butter Kulcha
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Butter Naan
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Naan
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Onion Kulcha
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Paneer Kulcha
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Parotha
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Roti
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Tandoori  Kulcha
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Thepla
desc: This version features a topping of finely chopped, juicy tomatoes. The tomatoes become soft and tangy as the uttapam cooks, lending a fresh and zesty flavor to the dish.

name: Hot and Sour Soup
desc: A staple of Indo-Chinese cuisine, Hot and Sour Soup is famous for its unique and bold flavor profile. It gets its taste from chili and pepper and its  tang from vinegar.

name: Tomato Soup
desc: This is a classic and universally loved Tomato Soup. It's known for its creamy texture and comforting, tangy flavor with a hint of sweetness.

name: Veg. Manchow Soup
desc: This is another extremely popular Indo-Chinese soup, and a huge favorite here. Veg Manchow Soup is a spicy and savory concoction, rich with the flavors of soy sauce, garlic, and ginger, and packed with finely chopped vegetables.

name: Chaas
desc: Chaas is a light and savory drink made by churning yogurt (dahi) with water and spices like salt, roasted cumin powder (jeera), and sometimes ginger or green chilies.

name: Chocolate Lassi
desc: This is a modern and indulgent take on the traditional lassi. It blends the classic yogurt base with the rich, sweet flavor of chocolate, creating a delicious dessert-like beverage.

name: Maaza
desc: Maaza is one of India's most beloved mango fruit drinks. It's famous for its rich, thick, and sweet flavor that tastes just like biting into a ripe, juicy mango.

name: Pepsi
desc: A globally recognized brand, Pepsi is a popular cola known for its sweet and refreshing taste.

name: Salted Lassi
desc: This is the savory version of lassi, very similar to the chaas (buttermilk) that is a staple in every Gujarati household. It's made by blending yogurt with salt and often spices like roasted cumin powder (jeera).

name: Spirte
desc: Sprite is a crisp and clear lemon-lime flavored soft drink. Known for its clean, refreshing taste and lack of caffeine, it's a very popular choice for quenching thirst on a hot day, especially during the summers here in Rajkot.

name: Sweet Lassi
desc: A traditional and cooling yogurt-based drink, Sweet Lassi is made by blending thick yogurt (dahi) with sugar and water until it's smooth and frothy.

name: Thums Up
desc: An iconic Indian cola brand, Thums Up is famous for its strong, fizzy, and slightly spicy flavor that sets it apart from other colas.

name: Mango Lassi
desc: A delightful and popular treat, Mango Lassi combines the creamy tang of yogurt with the sweet, luscious flavor of mango pulp.
